H0.text: what are three different types of hotel properties. Resort

H1.text: what are three different types of hotel properties. Hostel

H3.text: what are three different types of hotel properties. Botel

A4.text: A resort hotel is a hotel which often contains full-sized resort facilities with full-service accommodations and luxury amenities.

A5.text: A mega-resort is a type of destination which is of an exceptionally large size, sometimes featuring large-scale attractions (casino, golf course, theme park, multiple accommodations).

A6.text: A hostel is a form of low-cost, short-term shared sociable lodging where guests can rent a bed, usually a bunk bed in a dormitory sleeping 4â€“20 people, with shared use of a lounge and usually a kitchen.
